headline: UBS is bearish on the steel industry. Here's why.
summary: UBS has issued a double downgrade for Commercial Metals Company (CMC), lowering its rating from Buy to Sell. The downgrade comes as part of a broader assessment of the steel sector, with UBS noting that the industry's risk-reward profile has become "less compelling" and more "balanced." In the same sector review, UBS also downgraded Steel Dynamics (STLD) and Nucor (NUE) to Neutral. Check out more Market Domination here to watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: UBS downgrades steel stocks citing less compelling risk-reward post rally
summary: Investing.com -- UBS downgraded Nucor Corp (NYSE:NUE), Steel Dynamics Inc (NASDAQ:STLD), and Commercial Metals Company (NYSE:CMC), citing less compelling risk-reward dynamics following a strong rally in their shares.

headline: Nucor Hikes Quarterly Dividend, Raises Payout for 52 Straight Years
summary: Since commencing dividends in 1973, NUE has increased its regular or base dividend for 52 years in a row.
